alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 10:13AM CST until March 08 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Newport affecting Jackson and Independence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Newport. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Many thousands of acres of cropland are inundated. Water is near State Highway 14. Many private levees are overtopped allowing the river to flood cropland. Water in portions of Jacksonport State Park that are on river side of levee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon (March 05) to a crest of 26.5 feet just after midnight tonight (March 06). The forecast for this river and location is subject to change given additional rainfall in the forecast. Stay up to date to the latest river forecast for this site. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date White River Newport 26.0 25.8 Sun 9 AM 26.3 25.9 25.1 26.5 12 AM 3/06 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
